body_content.explanation: to stick together or cause things to stick together:
examples: In healthy people, the blood platelets will agglutinate rapidly.
Barley meal agglutinated in the high tropical humidity.
The antibody agglutinated the red blood cells of 70% of individuals in the study.

body_content.explanation: (of words or parts of words) to combine or be combined to form new words:
examples: These languages have a tendency to agglutinate words together.
Turkish is a language with an agglutinating morphology.
